org.mini2Dx.core.files

Interface FileHandle

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    LibgdxFileHandle

    public interface FileHandle

    • Method Detail

      • path

        java.lang.String path()
        Returns:
        the path of the file as specified on construction, e.g. Gdx.files.internal("dir/file.png") -> dir/file.png. backward slashes will be replaced by forward slashes.

      • normalize

        java.lang.String normalize()
        Returns the path with redundant path elements removed (i.e. dir/dir2/../file.png -> dir/file.png)
        Returns:

      • normalizedHandle

        FileHandle normalizedHandle()
        Returns this FileHandle resolved with a normalised path
        Returns:

      • name

        java.lang.String name()
        Returns:
        the name of the file, without any parent paths.

      • extension

        java.lang.String extension()

      • nameWithoutExtension

        java.lang.String nameWithoutExtension()
        Returns:
        the name of the file, without parent paths or the extension.

      • pathWithoutExtension

        java.lang.String pathWithoutExtension()
        Returns:
        the path and filename without the extension, e.g. dir/dir2/file.png -> dir/dir2/file. backward slashes will be returned as forward slashes.

      • type

        FileType type()

      • read

        java.io.InputStream read()
                  throws java.io.IOException
        Returns a stream for reading this file as bytes.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if the file handle represents a directory, doesn't exist, or could not be read.

      • read

        java.io.BufferedInputStream read(int bufferSize)
                          throws java.io.IOException
        Returns a buffered stream for reading this file as bytes.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if the file handle represents a directory, doesn't exist, or could not be read.

               throws java.io.IOException

                              java.lang.String charset)
                       throws java.io.IOException
        Returns a buffered reader for reading this file as characters.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if the file handle represents a directory, doesn't exist, or could not be read.

      • readString

        java.lang.String readString()
                     throws java.io.IOException
        Reads the entire file into a string using the platform's default charset.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if the file handle represents a directory, doesn't exist, or could not be read.

      • readString

        java.lang.String readString(java.lang.String charset)
                     throws java.io.IOException
        Reads the entire file into a string using the specified charset.
        Parameters:
        charset - If null the default charset is used.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if the file handle represents a directory, doesn't exist, or could not be read.

      • readBytes

        byte[] readBytes()
          throws java.io.IOException
        Reads the entire file into a byte array.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if the file handle represents a directory, doesn't exist, or could not be read.

      • readBytes

        int readBytes(byte[] bytes,
              int offset,
              int size)
       throws java.io.IOException
        Reads the entire file into the byte array. The byte array must be big enough to hold the file's data.
        Parameters:
        bytes - the array to load the file into
        offset - the offset to start writing bytes
        size - the number of bytes to read, see length()
        Returns:
        the number of read bytes
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • write

        java.io.OutputStream write(boolean append)
                    throws java.io.IOException
        Returns a stream for writing to this file. Parent directories will be created if necessary.
        Parameters:
        append - If false, this file will be overwritten if it exists, otherwise it will be appended.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if this file handle represents a directory, if it is a FileType.INTERNAL file, or if it could not be written.

      • write

        java.io.OutputStream write(boolean append,
                           int bufferSize)
                    throws java.io.IOException
        Returns a buffered stream for writing to this file. Parent directories will be created if necessary.
        Parameters:
        append - If false, this file will be overwritten if it exists, otherwise it will be appended.
        bufferSize - The size of the buffer.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if this file handle represents a directory, if it is a FileType.INTERNAL file, or if it could not be written.

      • write

        void write(java.io.InputStream input,
           boolean append)
    throws java.io.IOException
        Reads the remaining bytes from the specified stream and writes them to this file. The stream is closed. Parent directories will be created if necessary.
        Parameters:
        append - If false, this file will be overwritten if it exists, otherwise it will be appended.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if this file handle represents a directory, if it is a FileType.INTERNAL file, or if it could not be written.

      • writer

        java.io.Writer writer(boolean append)
               throws java.io.IOException
        Returns a writer for writing to this file using the default charset. Parent directories will be created if necessary.
        Parameters:
        append - If false, this file will be overwritten if it exists, otherwise it will be appended.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if this file handle represents a directory, if it is a FileType.INTERNAL file, or if it could not be written.

      • writer

        java.io.Writer writer(boolean append,
                      java.lang.String charset)
               throws java.io.IOException
        Returns a writer for writing to this file. Parent directories will be created if necessary.
        Parameters:
        append - If false, this file will be overwritten if it exists, otherwise it will be appended.
        charset - May be null to use the default charset.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if this file handle represents a directory, if it is a FileType.INTERNAL file, or if it could not be written.

      • writeString

        void writeString(java.lang.String string,
                 boolean append)
          throws java.io.IOException
        Writes the specified string to the file using the default charset. Parent directories will be created if necessary.
        Parameters:
        append - If false, this file will be overwritten if it exists, otherwise it will be appended.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if this file handle represents a directory, if it is a FileType.INTERNAL file, or if it could not be written.

      • writeString

        void writeString(java.lang.String string,
                 boolean append,
                 java.lang.String charset)
          throws java.io.IOException
        Writes the specified string to the file using the specified charset. Parent directories will be created if necessary.
        Parameters:
        append - If false, this file will be overwritten if it exists, otherwise it will be appended.
        charset - May be null to use the default charset.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if this file handle represents a directory, if it is a FileType.INTERNAL file, or if it could not be written.

      • writeBytes

        void writeBytes(byte[] bytes,
                boolean append)
         throws java.io.IOException
        Writes the specified bytes to the file. Parent directories will be created if necessary.
        Parameters:
        append - If false, this file will be overwritten if it exists, otherwise it will be appended.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if this file handle represents a directory, if it is a FileType.INTERNAL file, or if it could not be written.

      • writeBytes

        void writeBytes(byte[] bytes,
                int offset,
                int length,
                boolean append)
         throws java.io.IOException
        Writes the specified bytes to the file. Parent directories will be created if necessary.
        Parameters:
        append - If false, this file will be overwritten if it exists, otherwise it will be appended.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if this file handle represents a directory, if it is a FileType.INTERNAL file, or if it could not be written.

      • list

        FileHandle[] list()
           throws java.io.IOException
        Returns the paths to the children of this directory. Returns an empty list if this file handle represents a file and not a directory. On the desktop, an FileType.INTERNAL handle to a directory on the classpath will return a zero length array.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • list

        FileHandle[] list(java.io.FileFilter filter)
           throws java.io.IOException
        Returns the paths to the children of this directory that satisfy the specified filter. Returns an empty list if this file handle represents a file and not a directory. On the desktop, an FileType.INTERNAL handle to a directory on the classpath will return a zero length array.
        Parameters:
        filter - the FileFilter to filter files
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • list

        FileHandle[] list(java.io.FilenameFilter filter)
           throws java.io.IOException
        Returns the paths to the children of this directory that satisfy the specified filter. Returns an empty list if this file handle represents a file and not a directory. On the desktop, an FileType.INTERNAL handle to a directory on the classpath will return a zero length array.
        Parameters:
        filter - the FilenameFilter to filter files
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • list

        FileHandle[] list(java.lang.String suffix)
           throws java.io.IOException
        Returns the paths to the children of this directory with the specified suffix. Returns an empty list if this file handle represents a file and not a directory. On the desktop, an FileType.INTERNAL handle to a directory on the classpath will return a zero length array.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • isDirectory

        boolean isDirectory()
        Returns true if this file is a directory. Always returns false for classpath files. On Android, an FileType.INTERNAL handle to an empty directory will return false. On the desktop, an FileType.INTERNAL handle to a directory on the classpath will return false.

      • child

        FileHandle child(java.lang.String name)
        Returns a handle to the child with the specified name.

      • sibling

        FileHandle sibling(java.lang.String name)
        Returns a handle to the sibling with the specified name.

      • parent

        FileHandle parent()

      • mkdirs

        void mkdirs()
     throws java.io.IOException
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if this file handle is a FileType.INTERNAL file.

      • exists

        boolean exists()
        Returns true if the file exists. On Android, a FileType.INTERNAL handle to a directory will always return false. Note that this can be very slow for internal files on Android!

      • delete

        boolean delete()
        throws java.io.IOException
        Deletes this file or empty directory and returns success. Will not delete a directory that has children.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if this file handle is a FileType.INTERNAL file.

      • deleteDirectory

        boolean deleteDirectory()
                 throws java.io.IOException
        Deletes this file or directory and all children, recursively.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if this file handle is a FileType.INTERNAL file.

      • emptyDirectory

        void emptyDirectory()
             throws java.io.IOException
        Deletes all children of this directory, recursively.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if this file handle is a FileType.INTERNAL file.

      • emptyDirectory

        void emptyDirectory(boolean preserveTree)
             throws java.io.IOException
        Deletes all children of this directory, recursively. Optionally preserving the folder structure.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if this file handle is a FileType.INTERNAL file.

      • copyTo

        void copyTo(FileHandle dest)
     throws java.io.IOException
        Copies this file or directory to the specified file or directory. If this handle is a file, then 1) if the destination is a file, it is overwritten, or 2) if the destination is a directory, this file is copied into it, or 3) if the destination doesn't exist, mkdirs() is called on the destination's parent and this file is copied into it with a new name. If this handle is a directory, then 1) if the destination is a file, IOException is thrown, or 2) if the destination is a directory, this directory is copied into it recursively, overwriting existing files, or 3) if the destination doesn't exist, mkdirs() is called on the destination and this directory is copied into it recursively.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if the destination file handle is a FileType.INTERNAL file, or copying failed.

      • moveTo

        void moveTo(FileHandle dest)
     throws java.io.IOException
        Moves this file to the specified file, overwriting the file if it already exists.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if the source or destination file handle is a FileType.INTERNAL file.

      • length

        long length()
        Returns the length in bytes of this file, or 0 if this file is a directory, does not exist, or the size cannot otherwise be determined.

      • lastModified

        long lastModified()
        Returns the last modified time in milliseconds for this file. Zero is returned if the file doesn't exist. Zero is returned for FileType.INTERNAL files.
